definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: No hunting is allowed in the preserve.
When Esau left for the open country to hunt game and bring it back
sentences.chinese: 以扫往田野去打猎，要得野味带来。

sentences.english: Its only inhabitants were a few hunting and fishing tribes.
sentences.chinese: 当地唯一的住户是几个以打猎和捕鱼为生的部落。

sentences.english: True to its name, the Domaine du Chasseur is a hunting zone.
sentences.chinese: 像她的名字所显示的那样，这里是打猎的地方。

sentences.english: Hunting is not allowed in this part of the woods.
sentences.chinese: 在这片林子里，不允许打猎。

sentences.english: But an increasing number of girls now hunt.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在越来越多的女孩都打猎。

sentences.english: A few months later, the king and his men went hunting.
sentences.chinese: 几个月后，国王和他的随从们去打猎。

sentences.english: Employee said a deer bit him during hunting season.
sentences.chinese: 员农道正在打猎季候被鹿袭打了。

sentences.english: They lived by hunting and by gathering roots nuts, and wild fruits.
sentences.chinese: 他们靠打猎和收集树根果仁和野果为生。

sentences.english: Taking young children isn't safe in a hunt and would likely hinder progress.
sentences.chinese: 打猎时带着小孩子很不安全，也可能会阻碍进展。

sentences.english: Of course, a lot of the girls up here hunt.
sentences.chinese: 玛西说，“当然，这儿的许多女孩都在打猎。”

sentences.english: The Assyrians and Persians developed tree-filled parks for hunting on horseback.
sentences.chinese: 亚述人以及波斯人营造出为骑马打猎而专用的树林。

sentences.english: He was also saying that the shoguns bred these Akitas for combat and hunting.
sentences.chinese: 据说日本将军养殖秋田犬为了战斗和打猎。

sentences.english: Many American statestaunttout themselves as fishing and hunting paradises, and with good reason.
sentences.chinese: 许多美国州自诩是钓鱼打猎的天堂，而且理由很充分。

sentences.english: By the time of the inquest, the wildfowl season was at an end.
sentences.chinese: 在那次调查开始时，到了打猎季节的尾声。

sentences.english: Linda could have her own horse, and Jimmy could go hunting and fishing with his father.
sentences.chinese: 琳达可以有她自己的马，吉米能和父亲打猎和钓鱼。

definition: to go on a hunting expedition
to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
game/wild animals and birds hunted for food or sport
